Tactile sensors are employed wherever interactions between a contact surface and
the environment are to be measured and registered. Tactile sensors are useful in
a wide variety of applications for robotics and computer hardware and even
security systems.

A sensor's sensitivity indicates how much the sensor's output changes when the
measured quantity changes. The term tactile refers to the somatosensory system
or more commonly the sense of touch. A tactile sensor is a device which receives
and responds to a signal or stimulus having to do with force.

Tactile sensors are generally known and can be grouped into a number of
different types depending upon their construction; the most common groups are
piezoresistive, piezoelectric, capacitive and elastoresistive sensors. [http://www.springer.com/engineering/robotics/book/978-94-007-0578-
4 Robotic Tactile Sensing - Technologies and System]
